channel.title: Quick Question
channel.description: Well to start off, I have a source that has an anti-flooding and its really a pain to have, I would love to know how to remove this but I don't know how thats why I'm here.. So I'm thinking would this anti-flooding have something to do with the run.bat code thing, lol if you know what i mean by that.. Like for example: when you right click run.bat and click edit, that code thing that is in there, would that have something to do with the anti-flooding? and if it is that would I be able to replace that with something different and get rid of the anti-flooding? Hope that made sense..

item.title: Quick Question

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @Zoft Zoft
item.description:
@Zoft wrote:

Remove this code from Server.java,

[code] public void banHost(String host, int num) {
if (false) {
banned.add(host);
} else {
try {
misc.println(“BANNING HOST " + host + " (flooding)”);
banned.add(host);
delay = 2000;
delayUpdate = System.currentTimeMillis() + 60000;
} catch (Exception e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}
}

[/code]

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

Zoft:

Check Server.java for anything regarding the flooding. The old source I used had that problem, or you could post your run.bat.

i went in server.java and searched “flooding” and this came up

} 
public void banHost(String host, int num) {
	if (false) {
		banned.add(host);
	} else {
		try {
			misc.println("BANNING HOST " + host + " (flooding)");
			banned.add(host);
			delay = 2000;
			delayUpdate = System.currentTimeMillis() + 60000;
		} catch (Exception e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

}

public boolean checkHost(String host) {
	for (String h : banned) {
		if (h.equals(host))
			return false;
	}
	int num = 0;
	for (String h : connections) {
		if (host.equals(h)) {
			num++;
		}
	}
	if (num > 1) {
		banHost(host, num);
		return false;
	}

	if (checkLog("ipbans", host)) {
		System.out.println("They are in ip ban list!");
		return false; // ip ban added by bakatool
	}
	return true;
}

public boolean checkLog(String file, String playerName) {
	// check ipbans -bakatool
	try {
		BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("config//"
				+ file + ".txt"));
		String data = null;
		while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) {
			if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) {
				return true;
			}
		}</blockquote>

what do i do now?
